casebody.data:
Christopher ROLLER, Appellant, v. GE MEDICAL SYSTEMS INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES, INC., Appellee. No. 07-1887. United States Court of Appeals, Eighth Circuit. Submitted: May 22, 2008. Filed: June 9, 2008.

Before MURPHY, COLLOTON, and SHEPHERD, Circuit Judges.

[UNPUBLISHED]

PER CURIAM.

Christopher Roller appeals the district court’s1 grant of summary judgment in favor of his former employer, GE Medical Systems Information Technologies, Inc., on his claim of disability discrimination under the South Dakota Human Relations Act. Having carefully reviewed the record and considered Roller’s arguments, we find no basis for reversal. See Brannon v. Luco Mop Co., 521 F.3d 843, 848 (8th Cir.2008) (de novo standard of review).

Accordingly, we affirm. See 8th Cir. R. 47B.

. The Honorable Karen E. Schreier, Chief Judge, United States District Court for the District of South Dakota.
